dt: {bc}one of the usually paired compound saccular thoracic organs that constitute the basic respiratory organs of an air-breathing vertebrate
{bc}any of various respiratory organs of invertebrates
{bc}a device enabling individuals abandoning a submarine to rise to the surface
{bc}a mechanical device for regularly introducing fresh air into and withdrawing stale air from the lung {bc}{sx|respirator||} {dx}compare {dxt|iron lung||}{/dx}

et: Middle English {it}lunge{/it}, from Old English {it}lungen{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}lungun{/it} lung, {it}līhti{/it} light in weight {ma}{mat|light|}{/ma}
shortdef: one of the usually paired compound saccular thoracic organs that constitute the basic respiratory organs of an air-breathing vertebrate
any of various respiratory organs of invertebrates
a device enabling individuals abandoning a submarine to rise to the surface

dt: used for an underwater breathing apparatus
{bc}pneumoconiosis caused by habitual inhalation of coal dust

shortdef: pneumoconiosis caused by habitual inhalation of coal dust

dt: {bc}a saccular breathing organ in many arachnids containing thin folds of membrane arranged like the leaves of a book

shortdef: a saccular breathing organ in many arachnids containing thin folds of membrane arranged like the leaves of a book

dt: {bc}an acute pulmonary disorder characterized by sudden onset, fever, cough, expectoration, and breathlessness that results from the inhalation of spores in dust from moldy hay or straw

shortdef: an acute pulmonary disorder characterized by sudden onset, fever, cough, expectoration, and breathlessness that results from the inhalation of spores in dust from moldy hay or straw

dt: {bc}a device for artificial respiration in which rhythmic alternations in the air pressure in a chamber surrounding a patient's chest force air into and out of the lungs

shortdef: a device for artificial respiration in which rhythmic alternations in the air pressure in a chamber surrounding a patient's chest force air into and out of the lungs
